Quotes: There will be no lasting peace either in the heart of individuals or in social customs until death is outlawed.
Author: Albert Camus

Quotes: Technological progress is like an axe in the hands of a pathological criminal.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quotes: The man of science is a poor philosopher.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quotes: Probable impossibilities are to be preferred to improbable possibilities.
Author: Aristotel

Quotes: We sail within a vast sphere, ever drifting in uncertainty, driven from end to end.
Author: Blaise Pascal

Quotes: The supreme function of reason is to show man that some things are beyond reason.
Author: Blaise Pascal

Quotes: We derive our vitality from our store of madness.
Author: Emil Cioran

Quotes: No one recovers from the disease of being born, a deadly wound if there ever was one.
Author: Emil Cioran

Quotes: Anyone can escape into sleep, we are all geniuses when we dream, the butcher's the poet's equal there.
Author: Emil Cioran

Quotes: Philosophers write for professors;thinkers for writers.
Author: Emil Cioran

Quotes: Each concession we make is accompanied by an inner diminution of which we are not immediately conscious.
Author: Emil Cioran

Quotes: The more we try to rest ourselves from our Egos, the deeper we sink into it.
Author: Emil Cioran

Quotes: We define only out of despair, we must have a formula... to give a facade tot he void.
Author: Emil Cioran

Quotes: It is not the answer that enlightens, but the question.
Author: Eugene Ionesco

Quotes: A civil servant doesn't make jokes.
Author: Eugene Ionesco

Quotes: Explanation separates us from astonishment, which is the only gateway to the incomprehensible.
Author: Eugene Ionesco

Quotes: We are strong enough to bear the misfortunes of others.
Author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

Quotes: Idleness is the parent of psychology.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quotes: Morality is the herd-instinct in the individual.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quotes: Plato was a bore.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quotes: There are no moral phenomena at all, but only a moral interpretation of phenomena.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quotes: There are horrible people who, instead of solving a problem, tangle it up and make it harder to solve for anyone who wants to deal with it. Whoever does not know how to hit the nail on the head should be asked not to hit it at all.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quotes: All sciences are now under the obligation to prepare the ground for the future task of the philosopher, which is to solve the problem of value, to determine the true hierarchy of values.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quotes: The worst sin toward our fellow creatures is not to hate them, but to be indifferent to them: that's the essence of inhumanity.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quotes: No question is so difficult to answer as that to which the answer is obvious.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quotes: Chance, my dear, is the sovereign deity in child-bearing.
Author: Honore de Balzac

Quotes: Two things awe me most, the starry sky above me and the moral law within me.
Author: Immanuel Kant

Quotes: It is a mania shared by philosophers of all ages to deny what exists and to explain what does not exist.
Author: Jean Jacques Rousseau

Quotes: The more I see the less I know for sure.
Author: John Lennon

Quotes: Why I came here, I know not;where I shall go it is useless to inquire - in the midst of myriads of the living and the dead worlds, stars, systems, infinity, why should I be anxious about an atom?
Author: Lord Byron

Quotes: Nothing requires a greater effort of thought than arguments to justify the rule of non-thought.
Author: Milan Kundera

Quotes: He who follows his lessons tastes a profound peace, and looks upon everybody as a bunch of manure.
Author: Moliere

Quotes: Man can believe the impossible, but man can never believe the improbable.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quotes: The purpose of psychology is to give us a completely different idea of the things we know best.
Author: Paul Valery

Quotes: The folly of mistaking a paradox for a discovery, a metaphor for a proof, a torrent of verbiage for a spring of capital truths, and oneself for an oracle, is inborn in us.
Author: Paul Valery

Quotes: Above all things, reverence yourself.
Author: Pitagora

Quotes: Above the cloud with its shadow is the star with its light. Above all things reverence thyself.
Author: Pitagora

Quotes: I have hardly ever known a mathematician who was capable of reasoning.
Author: Plato

Quotes: Nirvana is not the blowing out of the candle. It is the extinguishing of the flame because day is come.
Author: Rabindranath Tagore

Quotes: Every new beginning comes from some other beginning's end.
Author: Seneca

Quotes: Philosophers have not kept up with modern developments in science. Particularly physics.
Author: Stephen Hawking

Quotes: The superfluous, a very necessary thing.
Author: Voltaire

Quotes: Judge a man by his questions rather than his answers.
Author: Voltaire

Quotes: Tis one thing to be tempted, another thing to fall.
Author: William Shakespeare
